course_title: Fresh Sem: Africn Amer Studies: Blk Middle Class & Vis.Culture
requirement_designation: First Year Seminar with Race & Ethnicity(*)
class_notes:
Title: Black Middle Class in visual culture


In this course, we will explore how impressions and representations of the Black middle class - (the established middle class and the aspiring middle class) have changed over the years.  The course will investigate how African American hairstyles, colorism, and family structure are used as signals of class in film. If race is portrayed using skin color, hair texture, etc, how is class portrayed? What signs are we looking for when we hear 'black middle class' that might be different from just 'American middle class'?


(Freshmen Only)
course_description: Variable topics in African American Studies.
